pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.5: _Paṭibhānacittaṁ_. _Citta_ is here equivalent to Sanskrit _citra_, which means colorful, variegated, decorative, etc., and by extension it also means a picture or painting, which seems to be the intended meaning here. _Paṭibhāna_ means something like impromptu imagination. [Sp.2.175]() specifies that it was a picture of a couple having sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.10: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](pli-tv-kd8:3.1.6).
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.15: “A lot” renders _bahukaṃ_. [Sp.2.176](): _Bahukampi sibbatīti sacepi sabbaṃ sūcikammaṃ pariyosāpetvā cīvaraṃ niṭṭhāpeti, ekameva pācittiyaṃ_, “_Bahukampi sibbati_: even if he finishes the robe after completing all the needle work, there is just one offense entailing confession.”
